CatDescriptText: Fred McCrary, Gary, Ind., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the house, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "No, I don't.  They should share in the family responsibility of sharing.  Whatever their needs are, the parents should provide, and this includes recreational activities.  My definition of allowance is giving of money to the kids without any work being..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Fred McCrary wearing dark straw hat, moustache, eyeglasses, and short sleeved plaid shirt, standing in front of building with leaded glass window
